answers.answer: I am not aware of mitrazapine or other antidepressants from the same class leading to diabetes.  Type-2 (the most common form) of diabetes is caused by the pancreas' inability to produce enough insulin to control blood sugar levels.  Insulin resistance is almost always in precursor to type-1 diabetes.  Insulin resistance is usually caused by a combination of hereditary factors and unhealthy lifestyle choices which contribute to excessive body fat.Although mitrazapine does not directly cause diabetes, treatment for depression may lead to changes in appetite, which in turn can contribute to weight gain and insulin resistance, which in turn can lead to diabetes in individuals at high risk.
